item.title: Meet the cement transport ship that makes cement ingredients while sailing
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: London-based Seabound has developed a carbon capture system that transforms CO2 from a ship's engine into limestone, which Heidelberg Materials will use to make cement.

item.title: UK retail giant Co-op confirms hackers stole all 6.5 million customer records
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The hackers stole the company's member list, which included customer names, addresses, and contact information.

item.title: Meta reportedly scores two more high-profile OpenAI researchers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI researcher Jason Wei will reportedly join Meta’s new Superintelligence Lab. Another team member, Hyung Won Chung, might also join Meta, as the company works to catch up to rivals in the AGI race.

item.title: Chinese authorities are using a new tool to hack seized phones and extract data
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Researchers warned that Chinese residents, and visitors to China, should be aware of the tool's existence and the risks it poses.

item.title: Of course, Grok’s AI companions want to have sex and burn down schools
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: xAI's first AI companions on the Grok app are a lustful anime girl and a homicidal panda.

item.title: The Chainsmokers’ Mantis Ventures closes $100M third fund
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The fund brings Mantis' assets under management to $225 million.

item.title: Amazon’s Kuiper satellites to get boost from rival SpaceX
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: Amazon is looking to its main competitor to get its next batch of Kuiper satellites to orbit.

item.title: US Army soldier pleads guilty to hacking telcos and extortion
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Cameron Wagenius had already pleaded guilty to other charges earlier this year.

item.title: A former OpenAI engineer describes what it’s really like to work there
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: A senior engineer describes the thrill, chaos, and exhaustion of working at OpenAI this past year while launching its coding agent Codex.

item.title: Meta fixes bug that could leak users’ AI prompts and generated content
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The tech giant fixed the security flaw, netting a security researcher $10,000 for privately disclosing the bug.

item.title: AV startup Pronto acquires off-road autonomous vehicle rival SafeAI
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Pronto.ai CEO Anthony Levandowski said the move is meant to help bolster his company's ranks with like-minded talent and complementary technology.

item.title: Mira Murati’s Thinking Machines Lab is worth $12B in seed round
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: The deal marks one of the largest seed rounds — or first funding rounds — in Silicon Valley history, representing the massive investor appetite to back promising new AI labs. Thinking Machines Lab is less than a year old and has yet to reveal what it's working on.

item.title: Google Discover adds AI summaries, threatening publishers with further traffic declines
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The feature will appear on iOS and Android in the U.S., with a focus on trending lifestyle topics like sports and entertainment. Google also noted the feature will make it easier for people to decide what pages they want to visit.

item.title: The rights to Fyre Festival sold on eBay for $245K
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Billy McFarland, the fraudster who brought you Fyre Festival, has sold the rights to the brand on eBay for $245,300. We do not yet know who the buyer is or what they plan to do with such cursed IP.

item.title: Lucid Motors will roll out hands-free highway driving this month
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Lucid Motors joins the likes of Ford, General Motors, and Tesla in offering an advanced driver assistance system that allows for hands-free driving.

item.title: Ukrainian hackers claim to have destroyed servers of Russian drone maker
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: A coalition of Ukrainian hackers breached and wiped systems belonging to Gaskar Group, a Moscow-based drone maker.

item.title: AI coding tools are shifting to a surprising place: The terminal
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: For years, code-editing tools like Cursor, Windsurf, and GitHub’s Copilot have been the standard for AI-powered software development. But as agentic AI grows more powerful and vibe-coding takes off, a subtle shift has changed how AI systems are interacting with software.

item.title: Research leaders urge tech industry to monitor AI’s ‘thoughts’
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Research leaders from OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google DeepMind are urging tech companies and research groups to monitor AI's "thoughts."

item.title: Venture gets a rare Native American-led fund in Betsy Fore’s Velveteen Ventures
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The firm will look to invest $500,000 to $4 million in 15-20 seed and Series A companies in the healthcare, climate, consumer, and community sectors.

item.title: Mistral releases Voxtral, its first open source AI audio model
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: French startup Mistral has jumped into the audio race with Voxtral, its first open model, aiming to challenge the dominance of walled-off corporate systems with open-weight alternatives.
